geocontour
  • geocontour package
  • View page source

geocontour package

Utilities for masking, contour tracing, and geocontour construction with gridded geographic data

Subpackages

  • geocontour.examples package
    • Functions serving as example use cases for geocontour
    • small()
    • large()
  • geocontour.tests package
    • Functions for testing of the geocontour package
    • full()
    • Submodules
      • geocontour.tests.timing module
        • Functions for comparatively testing speed of geocontour implementations
        • masksearch()
        • contourtrace()

Submodules

  • geocontour.check module
    • Functions for checking the properties of various structures utilized by
    • geocontour
    • cdim()
    • cboundary()
    • cmask()
    • ccontour()
    • cgeocontour()
  • geocontour.contourtrace module
    • Functions for tracing a contour on a lat/lon grid from an input mask
    • square()
    • moore()
    • moore_imp()
    • pavlidis()
    • pavlidis_imp()
    • TSR()
  • geocontour.contourutil module
    • Utility functions for operations involving contours and contour searches
    • findstart()
    • parsestart()
    • setstop()
    • clean()
    • fancysearch()
  • geocontour.geocontour module
    • Functions for construction of geocontours from contours
    • build()
  • geocontour.grid module
    • Functions for operations involving grid values and dimensions
    • spacing()
    • lonlens()
    • latlens()
    • lonlen()
    • latlen()
    • areas()
    • clonrng()
    • clatdir()
    • switchlon()
    • switchind()
  • geocontour.masksearch module
    • Functions for finding a mask on a lat/lon grid from an input boundary
    • center()
    • center2()
    • nodes()
    • nodes2()
    • area()
  • geocontour.maskutil module
    • Utility functions for operations involving masks and mask searches
    • bbox()
    • edge()
    • vertex()
    • neighbors()
    • conn()
  • geocontour.output module
    • Functions for visualizing and saving output produced by geocontour
    • plot()
    • save()
